result.execSummary:
The defendant Yusef Bin Usaamah Nolley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Defendant may apply for expungement of this case upon successful completion of probation and all terms. Same conditions for both counts.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yusef Bin Usaamah Nolley

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty Mark Lawton
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton

10:55 AM Cases called: 22CF70 and 22FO134. Defendant Yusef Bin Usaamah Nolley in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Yusef Bin Usaamah Nolley.  Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by State. Amended complaint filed. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1 & 2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentencing, placed the defendant on probation for 2 years each. Conditions of probation include: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Submit DNA sample. Costs of $443.00 on count 1 and $243.00 on count 2. Defendant may apply for expungement of this case upon successful completion of probation and all terms. State moved to dismiss 22FO134. Court dismissed. 3 days credit. 11:08 AM
